Story: Enhance Publishing Capabilities in Viralheat
Description:
Currently it is very basic. Lets add more features to publishing and make it more robust.

Below are high level specs, lets come up with a Mock and design it out.

- Not all the features have to go out in one shot, lets keep all these in mind while designing and we can slowly push out feature by feature.


Publishing Features:

1. Ability to Schedule the post to be sent at a later time.
- The user can schedule the tweet to be sent a specific time.
- The use can setup recurring tweet or updates (to be sent out on all network or certain networks)
- The system can suggest times to them to send the tweets out.

2. Ability to Preview the message.
- The user should be able to preview the message, as it is going to look once published on Twitter, Facebook and all support platforms.

3. Ability to attached links.
- The user should be able to attach links to the message that is published. 
- The URL should be shortened. Currently using bit.ly but later we can add more options or have our own URL Shortener.

4. User should be able to attach a location to the message published.
- User can attach a location to the tweet.


5. User should be able to attach or upload a picture to the message published..
- We should store these pictures on our end on Amazon etc or pass it directly yo Twitter / Facebook
- might need to store them if these tweets are scheduled to be sent out later.

6. (Advanced feature) Ability to syndicate content from RSS feeds.
- user should be able to attach their blog or RSS feed and as soon as a blog is published, it will go out on The pre-defined Twitter account.

  # This model implements the "publishable" concern
  include Publishable

  def _publish(user_id, message)    
    begin      
      ret = self.publish_facebook_location(message, user_id) 
    rescue Exception => e
      logger.info "ERROR: #{e.to_s}"
      case e.to_s
      when "OAuthException: Error validating application."
        # Invalidate this page
        self.is_invalid = 1
        self.save!
      else
        
      end
      # Throw other errors up the stack
      raise e
    end
    return ret
  end
